intro: Mayepea coriacea, commonly known as the rough-leaved mayepea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its thick, coriaceous (leathery) leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Mayepea coriacea is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its distinctive foliage and vibrant blooms.
